perturbation.original_text: AJR shall provide XC with such information regarding AJR as XC shall request for inclusion in the registration statement and shall indemnify the Company and hold it harmless with respect to any material misstatement or material omission with respect to such information (f) All Registrable Securities that are registered pursuant to Section 3(d) hereof shall be subject to the "lock-up" provided for in this Section 3(f) (the "Lock-Up"), and AJR agrees to be bound by the Lock-Up. Pursuant to the Lock-Up, AJR agrees that following the registration of Registrable Securities, it shall not directly or indirectly, sell, transfer, pledge, assign, gift, hypothecate or otherwise dispose of more than 25,000 shares of Common Stock during any five (5) consecutive trading days on the principal securities exchange or securities market where XC's Common Stock is then traded.
perturbation.changed_text: AJR shall provide XC with such information regarding AJR as XC shall request for inclusion in the registration statement and shall indemnify the Company and hold it harmless with respect to any material misstatement or material omission with respect to such information (f) All Registrable Securities that are registered pursuant to Section 3(d) hereof shall be subject to the "lock-up" provided for in this Section 3(f) (the "Lock-Up"), and AJR agrees to be bound by the Lock-Up. Pursuant to the Lock-Up, AJR agrees that following the registration of Registrable Securities, it shall directly or indirectly, sell, transfer, pledge, assign, gift, hypothecate or otherwise dispose of all shares of Common Stock immediately.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text removes the limitation on the number of shares AJR can sell within a specific timeframe and allows for the immediate disposal of all shares upon registration. This introduces a contradiction because such a restriction could violate federal securities laws requiring fair and orderly markets and could be deemed an unreasonable restraint on AJR's ability to manage its investment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Securities Laws (potential violation of fair market regulations)

perturbation.original_text: XC may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to AJR upon the occurrence of any of the following events (each an "AJR Event of Default"): (i) AJR breaches any material term, provision or covenant of this Agreement on the part of AJR to be observed or performed and such breach is not cured within ten (10) days after written notice of the breach is given by XC
perturbation.changed_text: XC may terminate this Agreement upon written notice to AJR upon the occurrence of any of the following events (each an "AJR Event of Default"): (i) AJR breaches any material term, provision or covenant of this Agreement on the part of AJR to be observed or performed and such breach is not cured within two (2) days after written notice of the breach is given by XC
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives AJR ten days to cure a breach of contract. This has been changed to two days, this is an unreasonable short time that may contradict standard legal practices regarding reasonable cure periods for breaches of contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness of Cure Period

perturbation.original_text: In the event a registration statement covering all of the Registrable Securities has -3- not been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on or before July 1, 2002, XC agrees to pay to AJR $10,000. XC shall pay to AJR an additional $10,000 for each thirty-day period thereafter (e.g., ending, August 1, September 1, etc.) in which a registration statement has not been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for purposes of registering all Registrable Securities. All such payments due hereunder shall be payable on or before the 5th of the month in which such payment becomes due.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event a registration statement covering all of the Registrable Securities has -3- not been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on or before July 1, 2002, XC agrees to pay to AJR $10,000. XC shall pay to AJR an additional $10,000 for each ninety-day period thereafter in which a registration statement has not been filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for purposes of registering all Registrable Securities. All such payments due hereunder shall be payable on or before the 1st of the following quarter in which such payment becomes due.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a penalty for each thirty-day period a registration statement is not filed, with payment due by the 5th of the following month. The modified text extends the period to ninety days and changes the payment deadline to the first of the following quarter. This is an unreasonable extension of the period in which the Securities and Exchange Commission has not had a registration statement filed.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Securities Laws (potential violation of SEC regulations)
